instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.Q9706: What is Q9706? Q9706 takes PPBUS_G3H's vltage and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q9706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R9788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q9706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0V but there is an image on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message: Any help? just messing around with some old boards i had laying around.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message:
Post diode mode there first; w/ and w/o LCD connected.
Also need voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q9706</TRANSISTOR>/07.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message:
Thanks mate. As i was about to take the the voltages i think i found the problem. Corroded probe point on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL>.
<RESISTOR>R9788</RESISTOR> Pin 1 0v but the backlight fuse has 12.6v on both sides.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message: Thanks for guiding me in the right direction, I ran a wire and it now has a backlight cheers mate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight
threads.message: Glad to hear you've solved it. :)
